We are a small team of players dedicated: We are a small team of players dedicated to developing high-quality tools for mir4. Even costing us money for maintenance, development, and domain retention, we make it available for free. If you like our work and can support to keep us in thriving, any amount is welcome.
Enter your tickets and your XP earned pe: Enter your tickets and your XP earned per run to calculate the time taken to level up paired with peak/square runs.
Enter your remaining vigor in hours to c: Enter your remaining vigor in hours to calculate your XP and percentage earned during an active vigor.
This action is irreversible and will res: This action is irreversible and will result in the loss of all your items.
Attention, you have a status upgrade tha: Attention, you have a status upgrade that requires a higher constitution tier and consequentially an upgrade in all other stats. The cost for them is not being accounted for.
Max Number of Magic Square Tickets: Max Number of Magic Square Tickets
Max Number of Secret Peak Tickets: Max Number of Secret Peak Tickets
Max number of Free EXP restores: Max number of Free EXP restores
Here you can add your owned items, eithe: Here you can add your owned items, either tradable or non-tradable and they will be counted for the total result of the recipe you are trying to calculate.
That's the main item frame where you can: That's the main item frame where you can control the selected recipe.
Here you can edit the values below each: Here you can edit the values below each item to your owned amount of them, this is useful for subtracting the total cost and seeing how many items are left.
Here you can choose how much you have of:
Here you can choose how much you have of this item so it can be subtracted from the total cost result on the bottom of the page. 

 You can also hover over the item, and if a recipe is available to it, you'll see a popup with the required items. (Your inventory affects this recipe)
Here's where you can see the result of a:
Here's where you can see the result of a calculation, this can be affected by your inventory items or rarity items visibility settings. 

 Remember you can hover over abstract numbers to see their specific values
This left panel shows the cost of items:
This left panel shows the cost of items with rarity, this can be a result of the necessary cost of base items for your recipe. 

 For example, this panel can account for the necessary items for crafting rare steel for a rare weapon.
This right panel shows the generic items:
This right panel shows the generic items for recipe crafting, this is the sum of ALL item's cost of copper for example. 

 Note that this is going, to sum up the cost of base resources, secondary, tertiary, and so on.
You can start a five minutes timer and s: You can start a five minutes timer and start measuring your performance, make sure to mark the start experience percentage and insert the final percentage when the times end up.
Here you can use the measurement by perc: Here you can use the measurement by percentages which you need to use the timer, or you can use the second two inputs if you know your gain per minute.
The use of the 5 minutes timer is requir: The use of the 5 minutes timer is required. Recommended if is the first time measuring your performance.
Recommended for users who have already m: Recommended for users who have already measured experience gainings or if you already know the xp amount earned per minute.
Insert your current and desired level, w:
Insert your current and desired level, when the necessary fields are correctly filled, you'll be able to see:

Remaining XP to the desired level. (accounts for your current percentage)
The amount of time needed to reach your desired level.
Your XP gains every 5 minutes.
